messages.message:
David
Mammoth:
For those three who didn't pay Ian, hotel is $65 to me.
Gas is $60 to your driver. Someone paid me $36 in cash at a fillup but I forget who. If that was you, you owe me $24 instead.
Eddie mumbled something about more groceries to split but I didn't understand.

Vegas:
Travis, $30 to Sharon for hotel if you haven't already.
$30 for gas but everyone's already paid.

Brian
We split groceries in Flagstaff between our car, and in Bishop we split at that moment.  I paid for Davids rentals and a tank of Eddie's gas:
I owe David $65 - $40 = $25, and gas $60 - (40.50 * 2/3) = $33
Correct?

Joseph
I think I gave you $36 for gas one of the nights driving there. So I'm thinking I owe ((($60) - ($36)) + ((((1/4))*(60)))) = 39 ( I think I put the parentheses on (right), :) ), because I want to pay a portion of your gas David because you drove your car, and there's definitely wear and tear associated with that.

Eddie
Actually forget about the groceries. I'm gifting the alcohol to Travis anyway. But I want the cinnamon, rosemary, and a few other things...

David
I think they're in my garage under Jessie's car.
Oh, yes, forgot to mention the rentals. Looks good Brian.
